Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid has once again been named the NHL’s first star of the week. It’s the second week in a row the 28-year-old superstar has earned the honour and comes after he put up five goals and five assists over four games, scoring in each appearance. McDavid now has 62 points (23 goals, 39 assists), the most in the NHL, one ahead of Colorado Avalanche powerhouse Nathan MacKinnon. McDavid leads the NHL with 62 points this season. His performance contributed to the Oilers' 18-13-6 record, placing them third in the Pacific Division. Ottawa Senators goalie Linus Ullmark was named the second star of the week.

summary: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has captured an image of two interacting dwarf galaxies, NGC 4490 and NGC 4485, located about 24 million light-years away in the constellation Canes Venatici. Released on December 2, 2025, this is the closest known interacting dwarf-dwarf galaxy system observed by astronomers, offering new insights into galaxy evolution in the early universe.
